result.execSummary:
All charges against Donald Raymond Harris in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald Raymond Harris is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Raymond Harris

records.addlTxt: by Attorney Bastien, filed.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Donald Raymond Harris.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-07-2022, filed.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Donald Raymond Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 10/10/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.9.22, filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.26.22

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.23.22, filed.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant appears via zoom audio only. For reasons stated on the record, Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing for the defendant to appear in person.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.6.22, filed.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State v. Lee Hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently appointed. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court reschedules the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.25.22, filed.
Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Next date for State V. Lee hearing of 6/1/2022 is changed to 5/25/2022 at 8:30am. Atty Tom Reed is unavailable for the 6/1/2022 date. Parties are notified.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court in person.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.16.22, filed.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4.8.22, filed.

22RM016766  Actual Date Bond Posted with *Sheriff
03/24/2022

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JMD (DOB 1/8/99)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; No Contact Order.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Donald Raymond Harris in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donald Raymond Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
